text.more:
The 22 bubbles of the JRME 1990s:
(1) van Hiele Understanding and Development of Geometry
(2) Equity and Politics of Mathematics Education
(3) Number Sense
(4) Children’s Place-Value Addition and Subtraction
(5) Mathematics Knowledge for Teaching
(6) Case Studies of Teachers
(7) Word Problems and Problem-Solving
(8) Probability
(9) Children’s Learning in Classrooms
(10) Second International Mathematics Study
(11) Constructivist Research on Teaching and Learning
(12) Problem Solving
(13) Teachers of Mathematics
(14) Mathematics Anxiety & Sex Differences
(15) Cognitively Guided Instruction
(16) Language and the Construction of Meaning
(17) Multiplicative Reasoning
(18) NCTM Standards & Culturally-Relevant Mathematics
(19) Mathematics Achievement
(20) Multicultural and Critical Mathematics Education
(21) Critical Responses to Theories of Learning, and 
(22) Experience of Learning Mathematics.
text.intro: Map of the JRME 1990s with 22 bubbles.
text.title: JRME1990s
